TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ObjectListFieldCollection extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Web.UI.IStateManager, class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class object provides the container for the fields of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>. Accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Fields%2A> property of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> retrieves an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection> object.
The properties and methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection> class are a superset of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface. All properties and methods of that interface, including those that it inherits from the ASP.NET <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface, are applicable here. This class provides additional properties and methods to modify the collection. These properties and methods provide standard collection management capability, such as adding, removing, and clearing the collection.
If you change the collection by calling the methods <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.AddAt%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.Remove%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.RemoveAt%2A> during Page_Init, the view state for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Fields%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Items%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ViewMode%2A> properties of the object list is ignored.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.param: The to add to the end of the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a field to the end of the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface. Adding a field to the field collection of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control and requires you to bind data to the control again.

Docs.param: The location in the collection at which to add the field.
The field to add at the specified location in the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a field at the location in the collection specified by the index parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A value of -1 for the `index` parameter specifies that the field is added to the end of the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.Clear%2A> method for all the classes where this method applies. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.Clear%2A> method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection>, it clears all the choices in the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

Docs.param: A string to compare with the or property.
Docs.summary: Returns the index of a field. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: The index of the specified field.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the second version of this method, it searches for a field with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField.Title%2A> property `fieldId` and returns the first matching field. If no match is found, it searches for a field with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField.DataField%2A> property's `fieldID` parameter and returns the first matching field. Otherwise, it returns -1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the first version of this method, it returns the index of the specified field. If the specified field is not in the collection, it returns -1.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void TrackViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Instructs the collection to track changes to its view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks After this method has been called, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property will return `true`. Also, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> will be set to `true`.
